page.title: 10FARMING
page.content: The agriculture of this block is mainly arable, on soils ranging from medium clay loams to heavy boulder clay. The major crop is winter wheat grown in rotation with winter barley & winter oil seed rape, the main break crop. Peas grown for vining or dried for human & animal consumption are also break crops. Other crops grown are sugar beet, field beans, spring barley, winter & spring oats.One orchard produces eating & cooking apples. Average farm size is between 100 & 50 acres, ranging from approximately 20 to 250 acres. Livestock is chiefly pigs with breeding & fattening herds of up to 140 sows & many smaller units. Other livestock includes:laying hens, broiler chickens, sheep, turkeys, beef cattle, veal calves and a small dairy herd.
